definitions.definition: a person who is not a member of the armed forces or the police

examples.text: Two soldiers and one civilian were killed in the explosion.
Hundreds of **innocent civilians** have died in the air strikes.
Further measures are needed to protect civilians.
The group was accused of targeting civilians.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (denoting a practitioner of civil law): from Old French civilien, in the phrase droit civilien ‘civil law’. The current sense arose in the early 19th cent.
